physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cranial nerves were normal. Mild gait ataxia observed. Wasted right abductor pollicis brevis and dorsal interossei of both hands. Tone was normal; no fasciculations. Mild weakness bilaterally in shoulder abduction, APB, finger abduction, hip flexion, knee flexion, and dorsiflexion of the ankle. Impaired left heel-shin testing. All reflexes present except for right ankle jerk. Left plantar reflex flexor, right equivocal. Stocking and glove light touch and pinprick impairment to mid-calf/wrist. Proprioception impaired at the toes; vibration sense intact. General examination unremarkable.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression noted; profound gait ataxia developed 1 month later. Numbness and painful dysesthesia spread to the umbilicus. Intention tremor of the left arm noted, no progression in upper limb weakness. Pyramidal weakness of the legs observed and bilateral heel shin ataxia reported. Pathologically brisk knee jerks and extensor plantar reflexes evident. Light touch and pinprick impairment extended to mid forearms and below umbilicus. Proprioception lost at toes and ankles.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Macrocytic anemia noted (MCV 102 fl, hemoglobin 11.4 g/dL). Lymphopenia (1.3 /H11003109/L). Normal white cell (4.9 /H11003109/L) and platelet (239 /H110031012/L) counts. Serum vitamin B12 was elevated (1,500 ng/L). Normal plasma glucose and HbA1c. Absent urine methylmalonic acid.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Anemia was identified as secondary to copper deficiency after IV copper replacement therapy normalized serum levels.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Signs of copper deficiency noted (serum copper 2 /H9262mol/L and ceruloplasmin 0.04 mg/L). Slit lamp examination showed no Kayser Fleischer rings.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 8 days of IV copper replacement therapy, serum copper levels normalized, and the hematologic abnormalities resolved. Despite treatment halting rapid progression, the patient had not yet shown improvement.
